qualitative_description: The C++ candidate implements a standard discrete-time NPZ with Monod nutrient-limited phytoplankton growth, Holling type II grazing, assimilation efficiency, linear zooplankton mortality, and an explicit quadratic (density-dependent) phytoplankton mortality term. It differs from the TRUTH NPZ which uses a more complex phytoplankton growth term (nutrient Monod times a P-dependent light/shading factor), Holling type III (sigmoidal) grazing, explicit mixing/entrainment for N and P, and separate recycling fractions (alpha, beta, gamma). The candidate therefore matches many ecological roles but uses alternate functional forms (Monod uptake, Holling II grazing, quadratic mortality) and omits mixing terms present in TRUTH.

nutrient_equation_uptake.matched_form: Michaelis-Menten / Monod uptake (growth_rate = r * N/(K_N + N))
nutrient_equation_uptake.explanation: Candidate uses Monod uptake and removes nutrients via P_growth: "Type growth_rate = r * N_prev / (K_N + N_prev); Type P_growth = growth_rate * P_prev * dt;" and N update: "N_pred(i) = N_prev - P_growth + ...". TRUTH uses N/(e+N) * (a/(b + c*P)) * P (product with a P-dependent term), so this is an alternate Monod-only uptake.

nutrient_equation_recycling.matched_form: Recycling via unassimilated grazing and mortality (assimilation inefficiency, full mortality recycling)
nutrient_equation_recycling.explanation: Candidate returns unassimilated grazing and mortality to N: "N_pred(i) = N_prev - P_growth + P_mortality + Z_mortality + (Type(1.0) - e) * P_grazed;" This corresponds to recycling from grazing/excretion (alternate formulation using assimilation efficiency e). TRUTH uses beta*lambda_*P^2/(mu^2+P^2) * Z and gamma*q*Z with separate fractions.

nutrient_equation_mixing.explanation: TRUTH includes a mixing/entrainment term k*(N0 - N) in dN/dt. Candidate has no equivalent term (no k or N0 present), so the mixing component is missing.

phytoplankton_equation_growth.explanation: Candidate: "Type growth_rate = r * N_prev / (K_N + N_prev); Type P_growth = growth_rate * P_prev * dt; P_pred(i) = P_prev + P_growth - ..." TRUTH uses a product N/(e+N) * (a/(b + c * P)) * P which includes an additional P-dependent light/shading term not present here.

phytoplankton_equation_grazing_loss.matched_form: Holling Type II grazing (g_max * P/(K_P + P) times Z)
phytoplankton_equation_grazing_loss.explanation: Candidate: "Type grazing_rate = g_max * P_prev / (K_P + P_prev); Type P_grazed = grazing_rate * Z_prev * dt; P_pred(i) = ... - P_grazed ..." TRUTH uses a sigmoidal (P^2/(mu^2+P^2)) Holling type III form, so this is an alternate Holling II.

phytoplankton_equation_mortality.matched_form: Linear plus quadratic (density-dependent) mortality (m_P * P + m_P2 * P^2)
phytoplankton_equation_mortality.explanation: Candidate computes: "Type mortality_rate = m_P + m_P2 * P_prev; Type P_mortality = mortality_rate * P_prev * dt;" which yields m_P*P + m_P2*P^2. TRUTH uses linear mortality terms (r*P and s*P) but no explicit quadratic P^2 mortality; the quadratic component is an alternate (listed in literature).

phytoplankton_equation_mixing.explanation: TRUTH includes physical loss via mixing/entrainment in dP/dt through the k term ((s + k)*P). The candidate does not include any mixing/entrainment term for P (no k or N0), so this component is missing.

zooplankton_equation_growth.matched_form: Grazing-driven growth with assimilation efficiency (e * g(P) * Z), here Holling II
zooplankton_equation_growth.explanation: Candidate: "Type Z_growth = e * P_grazed;" with P_grazed = g(P) * Z * dt where g(P)=g_max*P/(K_P+P). TRUTH: "(alpha * lambda_ * P**2 / (mu**2 + P**2)) * Z" (Holling III with assimilation alpha). Candidate matches the assimilation-by-grazing concept but uses Holling II alternately.

zooplankton_equation_mortality.explanation: Candidate: "Type Z_mortality = m_Z * Z_prev * dt; Z_pred(i) = Z_prev + Z_growth - Z_mortality;" TRUTH uses linear loss "- q * Z" in dZ/dt. Both are linear mortality terms (discrete-time vs continuous-time representation).

zooplankton_equation_mixing.explanation: TRUTH does not include an explicit zooplankton mixing/entrainment term in dZ/dt; Candidate likewise has no mixing term for Z. Thus the candidate matches TRUTH in having no zooplankton mixing term.

extra_components_description: 1) Density-dependent quadratic phytoplankton mortality: m_P2 produces a P^2 loss term (mortality_rate = m_P + m_P2 * P; P_mortality = mortality_rate * P => includes m_P2 * P^2). This quadratic mortality is not present in the TRUTH equations.
